column1: back of a length, bit of width, 84mph/135kph and Warner carves it away through the covers off the back foot! Bit of a freebie to start, nicely timed with a cross bat

Warner goes second ball, and Steyn is pumped! Length ball, plenty of bounce, found the top edge as he looked to flick it into the leg side, and it flew up to Shamsi at long leg on the boundary. Steyn brings out a slow-motion chainsaw celebration, and Warner looks disgruntled at the extent to which that shot up from a length
bludgeoned through the covers for four!
length outside off, looks to guide it through the off side and inside edges down to long leg
wide length ball outside the off stump, fenced out to cover on the edge of the ring
slower ball, slightly full of a length. Holds in the pitch, Smith pushes into the off side
width outside the off stump, sits up, and Finch flays it through cover point for four! Imperious
short ball, looks to tuck it into the leg side but it strikes the body and dribbles down at his feet
length outside off, punched through the covers off the back foot. Du Plessis races after it, and brings out a big dive to cut it off
length outside off, 86mph/139kph, Smith shuffles across looking to hoick from outside off and through midwicket, but can't lay bat on it
back of a length outside off, looks to crunch through the covers off the back foot but is through the shot early. Skews into the off side off the bat

short and wide outside the off stump, cut uppishly down to Steyn on the third-man boundary, but he loses sight of it right at the last moment and it flies over his right shoulder! Looks like he lost it in the floodlights, didn't make any attempt to catch it!
slower ball, Finch looks to flick through square leg but is struck on the thigh pad. Down at 69mph/110kph
length ball in the channel, fended out to cover on the back foot

dipping slower ball, turns into a low full toss, and clipped out to midwicket. This was the very slow slower ball, down at 74mph, which he foxed Bairstow with in the England series. Hard to pick out the hand
full and wide, Smith throws everything at it and slashes it through backward point for four!
driven out to mid-off for one
length, wide outside off, opens the face and flays it through point for four! Crunched, great shot
back-of-a-length outside off, Smith throws plenty at this looking to slug over midwicket, top-edged it over third man for six! That's what altitude will do...
steered down to third man
steep bounce, Finch is cramped for room but jabs his bat at it and guides it down to third man for a one-bounce four! Shaping to cut, done for pace but enough on it
length on off stump, driven to Smuts at cover. 91mph/147kph
length on leg stump, tickled round the corner to Shamsi on the 45
92mph/147kph yorker on off stump, dug out to straight midiwkcet
back of a length, tucked out to square leg off the hip
back of a length, steps outside leg and drives out to extra cover on the back foot. Hurls down the stumps at the non-striker's, but Smith is comfortably in
back of a length, pulled very hard in front of square and away for four! Powerful shot, sat back in his crease and nailed it in front of the man out on the fence
slower ball outside off, waits back in his crease and nails it over extra cover! Too short, Finch flings his bat at it and middles it for a one-bounce four
length, opens the face and steers down to wide third man for a couple. 88mph/142kph
full and straight, Finch lofts straight down the ground for six! Straight bat, opened up to get leg side of the ball, and launched over mid-off for an 82m maximum

wide outside the off stump, throws his hands at it, and it races away through backward point for four. Smith had so much time, transferred his weight onto the back foot and it sat up nicely off the pitch
worked out to short midwicket, can't beat the fielder
shuffles across to the off side, looks to guide it through point but inside edges towards midwicket
fullish outside off, Smith throws plenty at it looking to go through extra cover but inside edges past leg stump and away for four!
beaten all ends up! Not quite sure how that missed... came back into the right-hander, and cut him in half, jagging between the bat and the back leg, bouncing just over the top!
short and wide outside off, adjusts his weight and flays this through point for four! Absolutely thumped, not a great ball and Smith nails it over the man in the ring
full to start, whipped out to square leg, de Kock races after it to stop the second
legbreak, flatter, but down the leg side
down the leg side again, Shamsi under the pump. Short boundary is on the off side, hence this line
tossed up on off stump, clipped out to deep midwicket
speared down the leg side again, Shamsi in a spot of bother
cramps him for room, struck on the pad looking to work through midwicket
full on leg stump, tucked out behind square
tossed up, full on fifth stump, slugged out to deep midwicket
tucked out to square leg on the back foot
short and wide, and he'll have to bowl it again. Sloppy stuff from SA
slower ball, nudged out to mid-off
short ball, pulled hard and Smuts makes a great diving stop at deep backward square to save three runs
steered out to cover point, can't beat the fielder
length outside off, looks to carve through cover but can't lay bat on it. Finch looks filthy with himself
length on off stump, steered down to wide third man
length outside off, Smith shuffles across and pulls out to deep midwicket, but can only find the fielder on the bounce
fairly flat, slightly full of a length outside off, steered towards cover point

Finch steps outside leg, Shamsi follows him, he throws everything through the shot regardless but can't time it. Faf du Plessis settles underneath it at deep midwicket, and takes a good catch on the rope! Just about stayed inside the rope, and that breaks a very useful partnership
down the leg side, another wide
pushed out for a single
legbreak, good turn, carved out to deep cover off the back foot
nudged out to third man via the outside half of the bat for a single
tossed up outside off, bit of turn as Smith looks to drive through cover, and he inside edges through his legs and away towards backwards square
pushed out to mid-off for a jogged single

launched high, high, very high into the night sky towards deep midwicket... and dropped by van Biljon the debutant! Not the easiest chance, and there was some miscommunication with Rabada... Wade slog-swept, top-edged, and gets a life
leading edge into the off side, lands safely
whipped out to deep midwicket, and they hare back for a second
short and wide, steered out to cover on the edge of the ring and they race through
length on off stump, worked back to the bowler. Ricochets off Smith towards long-off, Wade thinks about stealing a run but Smith sends him back
tossed up, full and straight, worked back to Shamsi
Smith uses his feet, googly from Shamsi, short enough to work out to midwicket without any real problem
tossed up, wide outside the off stump. Wade throws his hands at it, and it flies aerially out towards backwards point. Rabada cuts it off, but they'll get back for a third
length ball, fired in flatter, tucked out to Miller grazing at cow corner
swept to short fine leg from outside off, they race through for a single
chipped straight down the ground, misfield from van der Dussen running in from long-off, but they don't take on the second run
bit of width outside off, driven to extra cover where Phehlukwayo makes a superb stop low to his left. Saves three runs
shuffles over to the off side, and Steyn looks to fire one in at the ribs. Called wide, harshly I'd suggest. Good bounce and carry
uses his feet, doesn't pick the 73mph/118kph slower ball, and checks his shot at the last, pushing into the covers
short and wide, crunched through point for four! Not a good ball, and Wade times the cut shot sweetly
shuffles across to the off stump, pulls firmly off the hip out to long leg for a couple

slower ball, length outside off, huge blow high into the air, but it's not got the distance on it to clear the long side of the ground... Miller settles underneath it at deep midwicket, and takes the catch! De Kock's aggressive move does the trick as Steyn strikes
slower ball, wayward down the leg side and he'll have to try again
short and wide outside off, cut aerially down to deep backward point on the bounce

length ball, down the leg side again and Smith uses his feet looking to work through midwicket... he can't lay bat on it, and de Kock whips the bails off! Think Shamsi saw him coming, dragged it down the leg side, and that's a very sharp stumping made to look easy by QdK. Huge moment!
full outside off, Carey gets down to sweep out to deep backward square
length ball, cramps him up, chipped out to midwicket
slightly full outside off, looks to cut but it keeps a touch low and hits the bottom of the bat
beaten outside off, de Kock whips the bails off but Carey didn't lift his back foot
slog sweeps out to deep midwicket, van der Dussen is in the game on the rope... but can only tip it over the bar! At full stretch, leaping, but can only get fingertips on it

length ball, sharp bounce, and edged behind! No, Paleker doesn't like it! SA review almost immediately. Rocked back looking to cut ... nothing on UltraEdge! Great decision, SA were convinced but they must have been deceived by another noise. Carey survives.
opens up, carving out to deep cover
speared in halfway down, clipped out to midwicket and they scamper back for a couple
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
length ball, slightly cramped for room as he pulls out to deep midwicket
speared in halfway down, cut out to Steyn in the covers
length outside off, clubbed to deep midwicket
hung wide outside the off stump, and called wide
length ball, sharp bounce, cut to Phehlukwayo at cover point
length ball, flashes hard, past backward point and in front of wide third man to run away for four! Offcutter, enough width to cut, and nicely played off the back foot
length ball pushed across him at 88mph/142kph, square-cut brilliantly away to the boundary! Played very late, beats backward point and races to the fence
length outside off, harshly called wide. Looked inside the tramlines to me
slashes at a slower ball, running it down to third man
back of a length ball, Marsh top-edges over the keeper for a one-bounce four! 88mph/142kph, looked to slug over square leg but was through it early, and bounces just inside the rope
tucked out to long leg off the hip
slower ball, rocks onto the back foot and cross-bats it down to long-on
looks to clip through the leg side, finds the outside edge, past de Kock's left hand and away for four! Deceived Carey, little cutter which he didn't pick, and Australia get another slice of luck
thumped to mid-off, Steyn makes an excellent diving stop
steers a back-of-a-length ball down to third man
slower ball, hangs back to nudge into the covers
cutter again, follows Carey as the batsman looks to give himself room and he can only nudge into the covers
wide on the crease, cutter, slashed out to deep backward point
length outside off, looks to thump through cover off the back foot and can't lay bat on it
slower ball, yorker-length on fourth stump, dug out to long-on. That's the dipping one out of the fingertips, down at 65mph/104kph
wide on the crease, quicker ball on a length, and beats Carey. 87mph/140kph this time, and does Carey for pace
shifts across to the off side looking to scoop, Steyn follows him and it skews off Carey's body down towards de Kock. Slight fumble, couple of leg byes
pulled out to square leg, dot to finish
cutter, Marsh is through the shot early looking to dump one over midwicket
wide yorker outside off, left alone and called wide. Phehlukwayo grimaces towards the umpire, but it looked like a fair call
length outside off, Marsh picks this one up early and hammers it over cow corner! 82 metres, clubbed hard out the meat of the bat
length outside off, carved out to deep cover

full on off stump, Carey throws everything at it but it flies straight up into the air... Faf sets himself at backward point, it comes down with snow on it but he takes an excellent catch before falling onto his back! Relief, after what seemed like an eternity under the high ball
wide of the off stump, carved out to the boundary-rider
punched out to deep cover to get off the mark
slowie in the channel, Agar looks to drive through the covers but can't lay bat on it
another cutter, fenced out to cover point to get big Mitch on strike
full toss, down the leg side

length outside off, clubbed very high into the leg side, and Steyn takes a brilliant catch! Looks to mow one over midwicket, top-edged it towards square leg, where Steyn ran in and round, before diving to take the chance... EDIT: only just clung on, landed in the fingertips and very nearly popped out!
nudged out to point, de Kock does the fielding and Agar turns down the second
slower ball, not picked and Starc is through the shot too early... beaten all ends up!
length outside off, clubbed miles into the air, and it carries this time! Starc throws plenty into the shot, it went high into the air and just about beat du Plessis at long-on... just the 74 metres
fullish outside off, slashed between extra cover and mid-off and away for four! Cleared the front dog, and carved into the gap
all the way this time! In the slot, Agar sits deep in the crease and slugs it just over mid-off
edged to short third man, where Shamsi takes an easy chance pulls out of it! Bizarre, miscommunication between de Kock and Shamsi, and neither of them went for what would have been an easy chance
yorker, dug out into the off side
back of a length, follows him, bottom-edged towards short midwicket and they scamper through for one
back of a length, looks to mow through midwicket but top-edged down to third man for four! Australia have had plenty of luck this innings, and that's how it ends, with a bit of fortune.
shortish outside off, 136kph/84mph and offering de Kock a little width as he chops through backward point, well stopped on the rope by the diving Mitchell Marsh
hard length, 136kph in the channel, punched square this time

zing go the bails! Top of middle stump pegged back! Boy that swung, a banana ball from Starc and de Kock slips up early in the chase! Fired in straight and then snaking back past de Kock's attempt to work across the line, pinging the woodwork
swing again, struck on the back pad... umpire Holdsworth not taken with the appeal, though! Maybe a touch high? Starc already a menace here
pitched up wide of off stump from over the wicket, 147kph/91mph and squeezed down towards third man to get off the mark
full and curling back malevolently to hit the pads again... but doing too much this time
fired in straight with the arm, Faf works a couple through backward square leg
length on off stump, 134kph/83mph and du Plessis stabs it down towards backward point
steps down and tries to hit him off his line, skewed into the leg side for one
good length, around off stump and van der Dussen pushes it towards mid-off
back of a length, 137kph/85mph and zipping through past the top edge as RVD² throws the hands and misses with a cut
fired in straighter, nudged behind square on the leg side
Starc fires this full in the channel outside off, left alone by Rassie
short of a length, banged in at 135kph/83mph and tapped down defensively from the crease
slammed into the pitch, van der Dussen swats at it, gloved over the keeper for four! Shout of 'catch!' from Starc but Carey wasn't getting there!
bit of width, 142kph/88mph and carved down to third man off a thick outside edge
pitched full, 144kph/89mph and angling across, too far across for the umpire's liking
back of a length outside off and whistling through as du Plessis attempts to ride the bounce
short on the pads, 143kph and he uses the pace to his advantage, smuggled down to fine leg for four! First boundary for du Plessis
back of a length, 139kph/87mph and kicking to hit high up the bat as RVD² defends on off stump

slapped straight up, h-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h towards third man... and taken by Starc! He had to plunge forward as the ball threatened to land short of him, but held it well, a spiralling chance into the Joburg night sky as RVD² flung the hands at a miscued drive. Cummins strikes second ball
shortish, nipping back to take the inside edge and then kiss du Plessis on the inside thigh... Kiss like a rottweiler, that is
back of a length, jabbed down into the covers as he starts to back away
brings out the scoop, gets it away to fine leg! Cute from Faf, moving across early and shovelling four
goes again, beyond the reach of Carey! Took this from well outside off, used the pace and got enough on it to pick up four more to fine leg
short and smoked through midwicket! Smuts latches on to his first ball and muscles it away
back of a length outside off, punched through the covers
shortish, maybe a cutter, just 118kph and du Plessis swings wildly only for it to come off the toe of the bat
pitched up in the channel, thumped to the man at extra cover but a misfield brings them one
shortish, 137kph/85mph and steered through the covers off the back foot
another slower ball wide of the stumps, du Plessis slaps it through the infield for one more
back of a length, 139kph/87mph and sliced past Carey off the toe, Starc does really well running around at third man to cut it off
short, pace off from Cummins, tucked through square leg off the back foot
tip and run to mid-off, Warner swoops and this could be tight... but he misses, when a direct hit would have left Smuts well short!
short ball, whirled on the pull towards short fine leg, Zampa cuts it off

top-edged on the pull, this is going to be a tough one... but Zamps holds it running back! The ball stayed up for an age, after Smuts failed to get hold of it, and Zampa must have been running around in circles from short fine leg, as he suddenly shot into view and grabbed on, before falling back and slamming his head into the turf. But he seems okay, and SA are three down!
stabbed into the covers, but well cut off
pushed through from over the wicket, turned with the spin for a couple

sliding across, Miller props forward - flicks the outside edge! Zampa and Carey go up in celebration and Miller isn't hanging around. Playing for spin and he just tickled through to the keeper, SA in all sorts of trouble here
tossed up, spinning on off stump and tapped away
pushed through flatter, steered for a single into the covers
another slider, angled in on off stump, Faf punches it away
lobbed up straighter, tucked off the front pad for a single to midwicket
pushed through from round the wicket, tapped through the covers
tossed up and punched towards cover
flatter, skidding on with the arm, nudged off the pads behind square

goes inside out, slugged over the off side... straight to the boundary rider! Du Plessis won't be making any more of a statement today! Agar with a loopy, wide delivery and he couldn't get the timing, plinked off the toe and it almost didn't carry to Richardson on the rope

given lbw first ball! May have been a touch leg side and Phehlukwayo reviews, but the replays quickly show that the ball pitched in line and was straightening bang on leg stump! This innings is quickly going belly up for South Africa!

GOTTIM!! Edged to slip! Tossed one up and Steyn, in no mood for backing down, had a big old yahoo, squirting a thick edge to Finch, who held it well! Agar goes bombing off, what a moment for him, and South Africa are on their knees in the Bullring!
flighted, on the stumps and worked around the corner
tossed up and Rabada defends on off stump
full on the stumps, Rabada tucks one through midwicket to get off the mark
pushed through straighter and van Biljon works it through backward square leg
tossed up and pushed into the covers
flighted, spinning a touch on off stump, KG defends
goes for the lofted drive... and only just clears mid-off! Van Biljon biffs it just well enough to pick up four
drops back and steers towards backward point, Rabada had come down but is sent back
tossed up, spins to hit PvB on the body as he sweeps... was that high? Agar isn't keen on a review, but it looked pretty close to me!
tapped into a gap coming across
whumped into the empty stands at deep midwicket! Cleanly struck slog-sweep from KG, gives the crowd something to cheer
pushed square on the off side, might have been two there but the calling wasn't great
low full toss, Rabada hangs back and gets an inside edge on to his pads
full again, bunted back down the track
slides a length ball down the leg side for a wide
pitched up, 142kph/88mph and sweetly clipped for four! Bisects mid-on and midwicket and rattles away to the rope
short ball, 143kph outside off, swing and a miss this time
flung down the leg side, Carey misses it as the ball bobbles in front of him... and fine leg won't get around, either! More donations to the poor
good length, 144kph/89mph and straightening with malice aforethought as Rabada fishes at a drive and fails to connect
pitched up, wide-ish and yorker-ish and it squeezes under the toe of the bat through to Carey
tossed up on the stumps and worked through the leg side
flatter, on the stumps and not much turn, van Biljon covers up in defence
edged wide of the tumbling Finch! Turn and bounce for Agar and van Biljon fences wildly at it, just out of reach at slip, might have even grazed the fingertips!
pushed through on the stumps and nudged behind square on the leg side
fired across the bows from round the wicket, Rabada slaps a cut to deep backward point

pegs back leg stump! That's a bingo for Agar, who has career-best figures! Dirty ole slog across the line from van Biljon, the ball gripping just enough as it skidded on underneath the bat. South Africa eight down and hurting
shortish outside off and Rabada slices one to third man
pitched up, Ngidi gets into line and jabs it towards mid-on
back of a length, in the channel and he fails to connect
short outside off, 136kph/84mph and again Ngidi swings hard but fails to connect
makes a bit of room and slaps it back down the track, Richardson gets a hand on it
banged in short, Rabada pulls - hoicked high into the crowd at fine leg! Rabada continuing to belt a few consolation runs for the SA cause
that's five! Plopped into the hands of long-on! Agar can barely believe it, he's king of the 'ring tonight. Misbegotten shot from Ngidi, straight to the man set back
so close to hitting off stump! Spinning through as Shamsi tried to cut and missed, nearly Agar's second 'trick of the game!
drops back and cuts, gets it through for a scrambled single
tossed up and tapped back
steps down and swings one more away through midwicket
floated up wide of the stumps, Shamsi comes across and pokes it away safely... Agar finishes with 5 for 25, and that has pretty much finished South Africa
tossed up and worked off the stumps
flicked for a single

bowled 'im, this one is done! Pushed through flatter and Rabada has one swing too many... Zampa hits middle, and South Africa have been retired on their stool! Australia win by 107 runs to go 1-0 up in the series
